borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p>Notwithstanding the provisions of The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification), no development falling within CLASSES A, B, C and E in Part 1 of Schedule 2 to that Order shall be carried out without the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority.<br></p>

<p class="Sub-SubTitle"><span style="font-family:Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:11pt">A) Notwithstanding the submitted Proposed Bike Store Document, no above ground works shall take place until revised drawings and documents showing:</span></p><ul><li class="Sub-SubTitle"><span style="font-size:11pt"><span style="font-family:Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif">internal stands/racks allowing both the frame and at least one wheel of the bike to be secured within the cycle storage,&nbsp;</span></span></li><li class="Sub-SubTitle"><span style="font-size:11pt"><span style="font-family:Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif">demonstrate that the cycle storage is suffcient to store all types of cycle,</span></span></li><li class="Sub-SubTitle"><span style="font-size:11pt"><span style="font-family:Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif">demonstrate on site location plan that the cycle storage will be well located close to the entrance, and</span></span></li><li class="Sub-SubTitle"><span style="font-size:11pt"><span style="font-family:Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif">demonstrate that the cycle parking will be fully covered.</span></span></li></ul><p class="Sub-SubTitle"><span style="font-family:Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:11pt">shall be submitted to and approved in writting by the Local Planning Authority. </span></p><p class="Sub-SubTitle"><span style="font-size:11pt"><span style="font-family:Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif">B) The approved cycle parking storage under part A of this conditon shall be provided in full prior to the first occupation of the residential dwellings.&nbsp;</span></span><span style="font-size:11pt"><span style="font-family:Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif">The cycle storage arrangements shall thereafter be retained.</span></span></p><p style="text-align:justify"><br></p>
The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the development hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing dwellinghouse.
The development hereby permitted shall be commenced before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

<p>The development hereby approved shall only be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and documents:</p><ul><li><span style="text-indent: -18pt;">Site Location Plan (drawing number Ex000)</span></li><li><span style="text-indent: -18pt;">Proposed Block Plan (drawing number P001 - P1)</span></li><li><span style="text-indent: -18pt;">Proposed Site Plan (drawing number P100 - P1)</span></li><li><span style="text-indent: -18pt;">Proposed Ground and First Floor Plan (drawing number
P101 - P1)</span></li><li><span style="text-indent: -18pt;">Proposed Loft and Roof Plan (drawing number P102
- P1)</span></li><li><span style="text-indent: -18pt;">Proposed Front, Rear, and Side Elevations (drawing
number P200 - P1)</span></li><li><span style="text-indent: -18pt;">Proposed Section Plan (drawing number P201 - P1)</span></li></ul><p>No other drawings or documents apply.</p>

<p><span style="font-family:Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:11pt">A) Prior to commencement of the development including works of demolition, a Construction Logistic&nbsp;Plan (CLP) Pro Forma&nbsp;must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details shall include the numbers, size and routes of construction vehicles, provisions within/around the site to ensure that all vehicles associated with the construction works are properly managed to prevent any unwanted disruption to other highway users, and other matters relating to traffic management to be agreed with the&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family:Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:14.6667px">licensing</span><span style="font-family:Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:11pt">&nbsp;officers of the council. </span></p><p><span style="font-family:Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif; font-size:11pt">B) Approved details shall be implemented throughout the project period and any changes to the document must be reported back to the&nbsp;Local Planning Authority planning and highways department.&nbsp;</span></p>

<p><span style="font-size: 11pt;"><span style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;">No development shall commence until:</span></span></p><ol style="list-style-type: lower-alpha;"><li><span style="font-size: 11pt;"><span style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;">an investigation and risk assessment, in addition to any assessment provided with the planning application, has been completed in accordance with a scheme to assess the nature and extent of any contamination on the site, whether or not it originates on the site. The contents of the scheme are subject to the approval in writing of the Local Planning Authority.</span></span></li></ol><p style="margin-left: 50px;">The investigation and risk assessment must be undertaken by competent persons and a written report of the findings must be produced. The written report is subject to the approval in writing of the Local Planning Authority. The report of the findings must include:</p><ol style="list-style-type: lower-roman;"><li><span style="font-size: 11pt;"><span style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;">a survey of the extent, scale and nature of contamination;</span></span></li><li><span style="font-size: 11pt;"><span style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;">an assessment of the potential risks to human health; property (existing or proposed) including buildings, crops, livestock, pets, woodland and service lines and pipes; adjoining land; groundwaters and surface waters; ecological systems; archaeological sites and ancient monuments; and</span></span></li><li><span style="font-size: 11pt;"><span style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;">an appraisal of remedial options, and proposal of the preferred option(s).</span></span></li></ol><p style="margin-left: 90pt;"><span style="font-size: 11pt;"><span style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;">This must be conducted in accordance with DEFRA and the Environment Agency’s ‘Model Procedures for the Management of Land Contamination, CLR 11’; and</span></span></p><ol start="2" style="list-style-type: lower-alpha;"><li><span style="font-size: 11pt;"><span style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;">a detailed remediation scheme, to bring the site to a condition suitable for the intended use by removing unacceptable risks to human health, buildings and other property and the natural and historical environment, has been prepared and submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval in writing. The scheme must include all works to be undertaken, proposed remediation objectives and remediation criteria, timetable of works and site management procedures. The scheme must ensure that the site will not qualify as contaminated land under Part 2A of the Environmental Protection Act 1990 in relation to the intended use of the land after remediation.</span></span></li><li><span style="font-size: 11pt;"><span style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;">The approved remediation scheme must be carried out in accordance with its terms prior to commencement of the development, other than that required to carry out remediation, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The Local Planning Authority must be given two weeks written notification of commencement of the remediation scheme works. Following completion of measures identified in the approved remediation scheme, a verification report that demonstrates the effectiveness of the remediation carried out must be produced and is subject to the approval in writing of the Local Planning Authority. The report shall include results of sampling and monitoring carried out to demonstrate that the site remediation criteria have been met</span></span></li><li><span style="font-size: 11pt;"><span style="font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;">In the event that contamination is found at any time when carrying out the approved development that was not previously identified it must be reported in writing immediately to the Local Planning Authority. An investigation and risk assessment must be undertaken in accordance with the requirements of (a), and where remediation is necessary a remediation scheme must be prepared in 37916 accordance with the requirements of (b), which is subject to the approval in writing of the Local Planning Authority. Following completion of measures identified in the approved remediation scheme a verification report must be prepared, which is subject to the approval in writing of the Local Planning Authority.</span></span></li></ol>
subdivision_of_building: Land at rear of 13 Leonard Avenue
description: Demolition of existing garage and construction of two semi-detached, two storey 4x bedroom dwellings with associated parking, refuse and amenities

constraints_details.result: 13 Leonard Avenue, Rush Green, Romford, Barking And Dagenham, RM7 0XL
